envRaster 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Add cell to df with lat/long

Source: R/add_raster_cell.R
add_raster_cell.Rd

Add cell to df with lat/long

add_raster_cell(
  ras,
  df,
  x = "long",
  y = "lat",
  crs_df = 4326,
  add_xy = FALSE,
  return_old_xy = FALSE,
  add_val = FALSE,
  force_new = TRUE
)

Arguments

ras

SpatRaster, or path to raster (needs to be path if running in parallel), with cell numbers to extract

df

Dataframe with x/y columns

x, y

Character. Name of columns in df with x and y coordinates

crs_df

Single length vector. What crs are x and y?

add_xy

Logical. Generate (centroid) x and y coords from cell? If TRUE, these will be returned as cell_x and cell_y where 'x' and 'y' are as defined by arguments x and y.

return_old_xy

Logical. If true, the original x and y values will be returned as old_x and old_y where 'x' and 'y' are as defined by arguments x and y.

add_val

Logical. If true the value(s) for cell will be extracted using terra::extract().The names of any columns resulting from add_val will be the same as the names in ras.

force_new

Logical. If there is already a column cell in df, remove it first?

Value

df with additional column cell with cell numbers from ras. Depending on the value of add_xy and return_old_xy, extra columns for centroid x and y values and old x and y values respetively. If add_val any values from ras. Note that, irrespective of the crs of ras, any returned x and y values will be in crs_df.

Examples


  #library(envRaster)

  out_dir <- file.path(system.file(package = "envRaster"), "examples")

  base_file <- fs::path(out_dir, "cube", "base.tif")

  if(!file.exists(base_file)) {

    make_base_grid(aoi
                   , out_res = 30
                   , out_epsg = 8059
                   , out_file = base_file
                   , datatype = "INT1U"
                   , overwrite = TRUE
                   )
  }

  base <- terra::rast(base_file)

  # random sample of points within the aoi
  sample <- matrix(nrow = 2, ncol = 2) %>% # include some NA x and y values
    rbind(sf::st_sample(aoi, 100) %>%
            sf::st_transform(crs = 4326) %>%
            sf::st_coordinates()
          ) %>%
    tibble::as_tibble() %>%
    dplyr::mutate(attribute = sample(letters[1:10], nrow(.), replace = TRUE))

  # add just cell to sample
  add_raster_cell(base
                  , sample
                  , x = "X"
                  , y = "Y"
                  )
#> Joining with `by = join_by(old_X, old_Y)`
#> # A tibble: 102 × 2
#>      cell attribute
#>     <dbl> <chr>    
#>  1     NA c        
#>  2     NA h        
#>  3 100976 d        
#>  4 117653 i        
#>  5  97215 a        
#>  6  73944 g        
#>  7  90150 d        
#>  8  74195 h        
#>  9  90814 j        
#> 10  58729 h        
#> # ℹ 92 more rows

  # add cell and cell centroids to sample
  add_raster_cell(base
                  , sample
                  , add_xy = TRUE
                  , x = "X"
                  , y = "Y"
                  )
#> Joining with `by = join_by(old_X, old_Y)`
#> # A tibble: 102 × 4
#>      cell attribute cell_X cell_Y
#>     <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>  <dbl>
#>  1     NA c            NA    NA  
#>  2     NA h            NA    NA  
#>  3 100976 d           140.  -34.6
#>  4 117653 i           140.  -34.6
#>  5  97215 a           140.  -34.6
#>  6  73944 g           140.  -34.5
#>  7  90150 d           140.  -34.5
#>  8  74195 h           140.  -34.5
#>  9  90814 j           140.  -34.5
#> 10  58729 h           140.  -34.5
#> # ℹ 92 more rows

  # add cell, cell centroids and original 'x' and 'y' to sample
  add_raster_cell(base
                  , sample
                  , add_xy = TRUE
                  , return_old_xy = TRUE
                  , x = "X"
                  , y = "Y"
                  )
#> Joining with `by = join_by(old_X, old_Y)`
#> # A tibble: 102 × 6
#>      cell old_X old_Y attribute cell_X cell_Y
#>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>  <dbl>
#>  1     NA   NA   NA   c            NA    NA  
#>  2     NA   NA   NA   h            NA    NA  
#>  3 100976  140. -34.6 d           140.  -34.6
#>  4 117653  140. -34.6 i           140.  -34.6
#>  5  97215  140. -34.6 a           140.  -34.6
#>  6  73944  140. -34.5 g           140.  -34.5
#>  7  90150  140. -34.5 d           140.  -34.5
#>  8  74195  140. -34.5 h           140.  -34.5
#>  9  90814  140. -34.5 j           140.  -34.5
#> 10  58729  140. -34.5 h           140.  -34.5
#> # ℹ 92 more rows

  # add cell, cell centroids, cell values and original 'x' and 'y' to sample
  add_raster_cell(base
                  , sample
                  , add_xy = TRUE
                  , return_old_xy = TRUE
                  , add_val = TRUE
                  , x = "X"
                  , y = "Y"
                  )
#> Joining with `by = join_by(old_X, old_Y)`
#> # A tibble: 102 × 7
#>      cell old_X old_Y attribute cell_X cell_Y  base
#>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>  <dbl> <int>
#>  1     NA   NA   NA   c            NA    NA      NA
#>  2     NA   NA   NA   h            NA    NA      NA
#>  3 100976  140. -34.6 d           140.  -34.6     1
#>  4 117653  140. -34.6 i           140.  -34.6     1
#>  5  97215  140. -34.6 a           140.  -34.6     1
#>  6  73944  140. -34.5 g           140.  -34.5     1
#>  7  90150  140. -34.5 d           140.  -34.5     1
#>  8  74195  140. -34.5 h           140.  -34.5     1
#>  9  90814  140. -34.5 j           140.  -34.5     1
